svcsubproc.title: Seats and Seating
svcsubproc.para: The standard school bus seating varies with the bus length or seat plan arrangement per the school district requirements. The row of seats can vary in seat length. Seats and mounting types may vary depending on the seat configuration required by the school district. Two leg with chair rail ( Fig. 59, Item 3) mounting is standard. Options include 4 leg seat mounting, track seating hardware and wheel chair mounts.

figure.caption: Figure 59. 30" and 45" Passenger Seats and Chair Rail Mounting

svcsubproc.para: The Small Child Restraint Seat ( Fig. 60) is an optional seat provided for children under certain height and weight designations. The seats are provided with a drop down cushion panel and shoulder harnesses to secure the specific child.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. SMALL CHILD RESTRAINT SEAT INNER PANEL
2. SMALL CHILD RESTRAINT SEAT IN UPRIGHT POSITION
3. SMALL CHILD RESTRAINT SEAT IN OPEN POSITION
5. CHILD SAFETY SEAT HARNESS SEAT BELTS

svcsubproc.para: Two point seat belts ( Fig. 61, Item 1) are an available option. The seats may be a 2 leg with chair rail mount, 4 leg direct mount or four leg with floor track ( Fig. 61, Item 2) for adjustability.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. TWO POINT LAP BELT ASSEMBLIES (45" SEAT SHOWN)
3. STANDARD SEAT BOTTOM FRAME AND CUSHION

svcsubproc.para: Flip up bottom emergency exit seats are also an available option ( Fig. 62, Item 1 and 2). These seats are mounted at the emergency exit door location, and have spring operation to keep them in the open position, until weight is placed on the seat to hold the seat cushion down in the transport position.

figure.caption: Figure 62. Emergency Exit Flip Up Seats

3. 2 POINT SEAT BELT (OPTIONAL) MOUNTING BOLTS AND NUTS
